item.title: How to Get the First N Bytes of a File
item.description: There comes a time when you just need to take a little off the top of a file, see what you are working with. That is where knowing how to use a utility like <a href="http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man1/head.1.html">head</a> can help. Just running: Will get you http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man1/head.1.htmlBut what if that file does not have nice lines? Large SQL dump files come to mind. head has an answer. Use the -c flag to print the beginning bytes of a file instead of lines.
